DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to assess if using tomosynthesis for breast cancer surveillance will allow a significant decrease of ultrasound cliches (and radiation exposure)
DOC.brief_title: Assessment of Substitution of Focused Cliches and Ultrasound for Tomosynthesis
DOC.criteria: woman with breast cancer histologically proven (group 1), on surveillance of a treated breast cancer (group 2) or diagnosis of an detected anomaly age ≥ 40 years (group 1, group 2); age ≥ 50 years (group 3) breast size suitable for detector size possible prior mastectomy security social covered signed informed consent breast implant high genetic risk (mutation) under justice measures breast feeding or pregnant woman
